title: Peer-to-Peer Delivery App
description: Real-time campus food delivery tracking with instant peer chat
detailedDescription: Built a peer-to-peer delivery platform enabling real-time campus food delivery tracking and instant communication between users. The system architecture leverages WebSockets for real-time updates and Firebase for reliable data synchronization. Token-based authentication ensures secure access control, while optimized API integrations minimize latency. The platform demonstrates strong full-stack capabilities with emphasis on real-time data handling and security.
features: Uses a fast PostgreSQL CTE to efficiently match pending requests and deliveries, updating statuses only if a valid match is found.
Implements a real-time chat system over WebSockets, providing sub-second message delivery with full persistence.
Token-based authentication reducing unauthorized access by 30%
Optimized API integrations for database queries and Firebase sync
PostgreSQL schema design for scalable order and user management
Responsive UI supporting concurrent users during peak hours
impact: Increased user retention by 25% through improved reliability
Reduced unauthorized logins by 30% with enhanced auth layer
Achieved platform trust metrics exceeding initial benchmarks
challenges: Implementing efficient WebSocket connection pooling for scalability
Designing token refresh mechanism to balance security and UX
Optimizing PostgreSQL queries to handle concurrent read/write operations
security: JWT-based authentication with secure token storage
Input validation and sanitization to prevent injection attacks
Rate limiting on API endpoints to prevent abuse

title: CodeVault - Full-Stack Coding Practice Platform
description: Robust coding practice platform with Docker-powered automated evaluation
detailedDescription: Developed a comprehensive coding practice platform featuring secure authentication, automated code evaluation, and real-time compilation. The system uses Docker containers for sandboxed code execution, supporting 15+ programming problems with rigorous test case validation. Backend architecture handles code submission queuing, execution orchestration, and result aggregation. The platform includes an interactive dashboard for tracking user progress and performance metrics across multiple programming challenges.
features: Firebase authentication with secure session management
Docker-based code runner executing in isolated containers
Support for 15+ programming problems with comprehensive test suites
Real-time code compilation with 10-second execution timeout
Interactive dashboard tracking problem completion and performance
Automated test case validation with detailed feedback
impact: Delivered robust platform supporting multiple concurrent code executions
Enabled automated assessment reducing manual evaluation overhead
Achieved sandbox security with containerized execution environment
challenges: Implementing secure Docker container orchestration for untrusted code
Designing timeout and resource limit mechanisms to prevent infinite loops
Building efficient test case runner with detailed error reporting
security: Sandboxed code execution preventing system-level access
Resource constraints (CPU, memory, time) on code execution
Input sanitization for code submissions to prevent injection

title: Web Intrusion Detector â€“ Browser Security Extension
description: Real-time Chrome extension detecting SQL injection, malicious redirects, and suspicious network activity
detailedDescription: Engineered a Chrome Manifest V3 security extension providing real-time detection of web-based attacks including SQL injection attempts, malicious redirects, high-volume network requests, and disguised downloads. The architecture employs a dual-layer approach: background service workers analyze network traffic patterns while content scripts monitor DOM manipulation and page behavior. A rules-based detection engine with event-driven listeners enables continuous monitoring with minimal performance overhead. Optimized for accuracy without disrupting normal browsing activity.
features: Real-time SQL injection pattern detection in form inputs and URLs
Malicious redirect identification through URL reputation analysis
High-volume network request monitoring for potential DDoS or data exfiltration
Disguised download detection via MIME type and filename analysis
Dual-layer architecture with background workers and content scripts
Rules-based detection engine with customizable threat signatures
impact: Optimized detection accuracy with minimal false positives
Achieved continuous monitoring with negligible browsing overhead
Demonstrated security engineering capabilities at browser level
challenges: Designing efficient pattern matching for SQL injection without regex overhead
Implementing isolated architecture compliant with Manifest V3 security model
Balancing detection sensitivity with performance constraints
security: Isolated service worker architecture preventing extension compromise
Event-driven listeners avoiding polling-based resource consumption
Privacy-focused design with no external data transmission
